Option 1: I am afraid my partner will th.Message: Sharing how we feel and talking about the difficulties we’re facing actually makes everyone in the family stronger! By sharing emotions you can better understand and support each other.

Option 2: I felt uncomfortable talking a.Message: Talking about our feelings or challenges we’re facing, can help others understand and support you better. Emotions and challenges are a part of life, and learning how to handle these, can help you avoid conflict with loved ones and make life less stressful.

Option 3: My partner felt uncomfortable.Message: Starting something new can be difficult. Give yourself and others time to get used to it. By setting a good example by sharing your emotions and challenges you’re facing, others will feel start to feel more comfortable sharing too.

Option 4: My partner asked many question.Message: Sharing your emotions or difficulties you are facing is about making others more aware of how you are feeling. You get to decide how much you want to share. You can also choose to share more at a later time.

Option 5: I felt too stressed or angry t.Message: It’s okay if you don’t want to share at that time. You can choose to share how you’re feeling at a later time once you feel calmer.
